title: Deck of destruction
data:
{{version030}} {{item |itemtype=Miscellaneous item |name=deck of destruction |cost=500 |weight=5 }} {{flavour|A deck of magical cards, most of which hurl death and destruction at one's foes (or, if unlucky, at oneself).}} The '''deck of destruction''' focuses on damaging and debilitating enemies. It is one of [[Nemelex Xobeh]]'s decks. Under Nemelex, you can hold up to 26 cards of this deck at once. It contains the following cards:{{source ref|0.30.1|decks.cc|80}} *[[Degeneration card|Degeneration]] (10.7%) *[[Orb card|the Orb]] (17.86%) *[[Pain card|Pain]] (17.86%) *[[Storm card|the Storm]] (17.86%) *[[Wild Magic card|Wild Magic]] (17.86%) *[[Vitriol card|Vitriol]] (17.86%) __NOTOC__ ==Strategy== The deck of destruction's cards can be simplified into three main categories: *2 (oft-)targetable, elemental attacks - may be piercing, losing 1 range per monster hit. *3 [[LOS]] attacks - which blow enemies away, mutate them, or deal raw damage. *1 [[Orb of Destruction]] - See the page for more details. Therefore, the deck tends to be most useful when there's a line of monsters, or when there's a ton of monsters at once. Of its cards, only [[Degeneration card|Degeneration]] is likely to be harmful; it polymorphs (which heals monsters), but tends to make easier monsters while inflicting the [[malmutate]] status. Thus, destruction gets few benefits from Triple Draw, though Nemelex's other two abilities work anywhere from decent to well (depending on what you actually get). ==See also== *[[Cards]] *[[Decks]] ==History== *Prior to [[0.23]], decks were physical items. *Prior to the deck simplification in [[0.19]], the deck of destruction was an archetype deck, with physical decks of destruction only pulling from the archetype. It was one of 4 decks to be kept in this version.
